heatTherapy.title: Heat Therapy
heatTherapy.subtitle: The simplest and most effective physical therapy
heatTherapy.description: Heat therapy promotes blood circulation and relaxes uterine smooth muscle through thermal effects, making it one of the most direct and effective methods for relieving menstrual pain.

parameters.title: Scientific Parameters
parameters.timingValue: Start 1-2 days before period for prevention
parameters.mechanismValue: Heat stimulates skin temperature receptors, blocking pain signals through 'gate control theory'

gateControl.title: Gate Control Theory
gateControl.description: Thermal stimulation activates large fiber nerves, inhibiting pain signals from small fibers

vasodilation.title: Vasodilation Effect
vasodilation.description: Heat promotes local vasodilation, improving uterine blood supply and relieving ischemic pain

guidelines.0: Avoid direct skin contact, use a towel barrier
guidelines.1: Do not use while sleeping to prevent low-temperature burns
guidelines.2: Stop if skin is broken or infected

herbalTherapy.title: Herbal Therapy
herbalTherapy.subtitle: Traditional wisdom meets modern validation
herbalTherapy.description: Herbal medicine has a long history in treating menstrual pain. Modern research confirms that active compounds have anti-inflammatory, analgesic, and hormone-regulating effects.

ginger.title: Ginger (Zingiber officinale)
ginger.mechanismValue: Inhibits prostaglandin synthesis, reduces uterine contractions
ginger.clinicalEvidenceValue: Studies show efficacy comparable to ibuprofen (Ozgoli et al., 2009)

angelica.title: Angelica (Angelica sinensis)
angelica.mechanismValue: Regulates estrogen levels, improves uterine blood circulation
angelica.classicFormulaValue: Si Wu Tang, Dang Gui Shao Yao San

gingerTea.title: Ginger Tea
gingerTea.description: Slice 10g fresh ginger, steep in boiling water for 10 minutes, start 3 days before period, 2-3 times daily

angelicaDecoction.title: Angelica Decoction
angelicaDecoction.description: 10g angelica, add 300ml water, simmer for 20 minutes, take during menstruation

guidelines.2: Consult Holistic Health practitioner for first use

faq.effectiveTherapies: Which natural therapies are most effective?
faq.effectiveTherapiesAnswer: Heat therapy, ginger tea, and moderate exercise are the most scientifically supported natural therapies.
faq.timeToEffect: How long does it take for natural therapies to work?
faq.timeToEffectAnswer: Heat therapy usually works within 15-20 minutes, while herbal therapies need 2-3 menstrual cycles of consistent use to see significant improvement.
